verbs.description: [ARG0: ballot signatures] [ARGM-MNR: wrongly] [V: disqualified] [ARG1: a socialist candidate for u s senate] is claiming town clerks across the state have erroneously disqualified signatures in his quest for ballot access fred linck an iraq war veteran needed to collect 7 500 signatures to attain ballot access and said he submitted more than 11 000 for verification by the september deadline linck alleges registrars in new haven hartford and bridgeport have rejected signatures for a variety of reasons and that some clerks missed the deadline to verify signatures and mail them to the secretary of the state office for certification we have been astonished to find such obvious and glaring errors in the validation of our signatures linck said new haven senate u s fred linck bridgeport hartford iraq united states senate secretary
